description:
Description
Data from a clinical trial of an interactive multimedia program called 
‘Beat the Blues’.
title: Beat the Blues Data
reference:
Longitudinal data from a clinical trial of 
an interactive, multimedia program known as "Beat the Blues" 
designed to deliver cognitive behavioural therapy 
to depressed patients via a computer terminal. 
Patients with depression recruited in primary       
care were randomised to either the Beating the Blues program,       
or to "Treatment as Usual (TAU)".

parameters.bdi.2m: Beck Depression Inventory II after two months.
parameters.bdi.pre:
Beck Depression Inventory
II before treatment.
parameters.length:
the length of the current episode of depression, 
a factor with levels <6m (less than six months) and 
>6m (more than six months).
parameters.bdi.6m: Beck Depression Inventory II after six months.
parameters.drug:
did the patient take anti-depressant
drugs (No or Yes).
parameters.bdi.8m: Beck Depression Inventory II after eight months.
parameters.treatment:
treatment group, 
a factor with levels TAU (treatment as usual)
and  BtheB (Beat the Blues)
parameters.bdi.4m: Beck Depression Inventory II after four months.

format:
A data frame with 100 observations of 100 patients 
on the following 8 variables.
